intro: Pteridoblechnum neglectum, commonly known as the neglected fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds with a distinctive, finely divided structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest undergrowth where it can receive indirect light. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are located on the underside of the fronds, a common feature in ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
